newsitem.title: BELGIUM: EU Commission rejects Seoul deadline on liquor.
newsitem.headline: EU Commission rejects Seoul deadline on liquor.

text.p: The European Commission rejected as unacceptable on Wednesday South Korea's offer to respond to EU complaints about its alcohol import regime and raised the possibility of WTO action, an official said.
"We have asked the Koreans for some reply and the deadline we have given for that reply is already over," a European Commission official told Reuters.

"I understand that the Koreans have given us a new deadline for the month of May. We find that as being too long and so we do not exclude the possibility of acting otherwise," the official said, a reference to possible legal action against South Korea within the World Trade Organisation.
The official said that EU complaints about South Korea's import regime resembled those raised against Japan's, which the WTO upheld last year.

Canada, the EU and the United States convinced the WTO Dispute Settlement Body that Japanese tax differentials on liquor sold in the country effectively favoured domestic shochu over imported whisky and other spirits.
"(The South Korean regime) is a similar one. They discriminate against foreign liquor in favour of local product," said the official, who asked not to be named.

Meanwhile in Edinburgh on Wednesday, the Scottish Whisky Association said 1996 whisky exports totalled 2.278 billion sterling ($3.850 billion), with the South Korean market the fourth biggest at 128.9 million sterling, up 44 percent on the previous year. ($=0.59 sterling)
